A4.text: Jean-Baptiste Donatien de Vimeur, comte de Rochambeau (1 July 1725 â€“ 10 May 1807) was a French Royal Army officer who played a critical role in the American victory at the siege of Yorktown in 1781 during the American Revolutionary War.

A5.text: On 22 September they combined with the Marquis de Lafayette's troops and forced Lord Cornwallis to surrender on 19 October.

A6.text: Washington led the army out of Williamsburg to surround Yorktown.

A7.text: Washington sent two columns to attack the last major remaining British outer defenses.
